decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and board state, utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It also includes card advantage and library manipulation to ensure consistency and staying ahead in card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den in the companion slot allows for additional value and recursion, making the deck more versatile and resilient against opposing strategies. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and closing out the game with efficient threats.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also removing threats with Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through drawing spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, as well as using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for recurring small creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency, with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Polluted Delta ensuring the player has the right colors of mana when needed.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly and efficiently. It utilizes various cards like Street Wraith, Thassa's Oracle, and Doomsday itself to set up a winning situation. The deck includes a mix of powerful spells such as Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and Force of Will to control the game and protect the combo. Additionally, it has card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to combo off and win the game before the opponent has a chance to disrupt it.

The deck revolves around utilizing Oath of Druids to put powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free. It also includes a variety of control elements like Force of Will and counter spells to protect the strategy. The deck also includes a Show and Tell package to cheat out powerful threats like Bolas's Citadel or Tinker targets. With a mix of ramp and card advantage, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan and controlling the board with a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures. By using cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, the deck aims to keep the opponent off balance while setting up its own win condition. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk allows the deck to generate card advantage and gain extra turns to further solidify its control over the game. With well-timed counter spells and removal, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures. By leveraging powerful mana rocks and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opposing strategies while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides a recurring source of card advantage and threat generation. Overall, the deck seeks to dictate the pace of the game and emerge victorious through superior resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck revolves around using mana acceleration and artifact synergies to generate a large amount of mana quickly, enabling the player to cast powerful spells and activate abilities multiple times in a single turn. The combination of mana rocks like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker allows for explosive turns where the player can draw cards, untap their artifacts, and set up game-winning combos. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor helps control the game until the player can assemble their win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize various artifact cards, such as Phyrexian Metamorph, Coveted Jewel, and Grim Monolith, in combination with powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome and Force of Will to quickly assemble a winning combo. By generating mana through cards like Mana Vault and Sol Ring, and manipulating artifacts with cards like Manifold Key and Mystic Forge, the deck aims to create a strong board state and win condition, potentially through infinite loops or game-ending plays. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator adds additional versatility and synergy to the overall strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By utilizing powerful spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push, along with versatile cards like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while staying ahead in card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of resilience, allowing the player to constantly recur low-cost threats and spells to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Doomsday card to set up a winning combination of cards in a single turn. The deck includes various powerful card selection and draw spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Ancestral Recall to find the necessary combo pieces quickly. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo from opponent's interference. The key strategy is to efficiently draw and set up the Doomsday combo while managing resources and protecting against opponent's disruption to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around disrupting your opponent's game plan with a variety of control elements such as counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage and manipulating the battlefield with cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. By efficiently controlling the tempo of the game and consistently denying your opponent resources, you aim to outlast them and secure victory through card advantage and strategic decision making. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional flexibility and resilience to the deck's strategy.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents' game plans by playing hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, while also controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Witch Enchanter. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy by taxing their spells, limiting their mana, and generating card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for fast mana acceleration, as well as disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's plans.

The primary focus of this deck is to generate infinite mana and draw a large portion of the deck using cards like Paradoxical Outcome, Tinker, and Mystic Forge. By utilizing artifacts like Grim Monolith, The One Ring, and Coveted Jewel along with powerful mana accelerants such as Sol Ring and Mana Crypt, the deck aims to set up a dominating board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Trinisphere and Force of Will. This deck relies heavily on its ability to combo off quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel, then using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts back to hand and draw cards. It looks to assemble the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo for infinite turns, or utilize Tinker to tutor for key artifacts. With protection from Force of Will and disruption from Sink into Stupor, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifacts and disruptive spells. Karn, the Great Creator is included for additional utility and disruption options.

This deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Using a combination of efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, alongside powerful spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest provide additional value and versatility to the deck, making it a strong contender in a competitive Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe while also utilizing counterspells and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides card advantage and slows down the opponent, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns can also disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck aims to apply pressure with efficient creatures like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters while also utilizing powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to stay ahead of the opponent. The mana base is streamlined to support the multicolor spells and provide mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine.

This deck focuses on using controlling spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage with powerful draw spells. It also leverages powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to ramp up quickly and cast game-winning cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. By efficiently controlling the board and drawing through the deck, this deck aims to outvalue and outplay the opponent in a 1 vs 1 match, utilizing the Dimir color identity to access a wide range of disruptive and powerful cards.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck includes a high number of cantrips and draw spells to help find the combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of Force of Will and counter spells to protect the combo. The deck also includes fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate the combo. Overall, the main goal of the deck is to efficiently and consistently execute the Doomsday combo to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful mechanic of Dredge to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures and spells, allowing for explosive plays and combos. By repeatedly dredging cards from the deck into the graveyard, the deck can quickly bring back multiple creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba, as well as trigger effects like Creeping Chill. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Force of Will to control the game and protect its combo pieces. Bazaar of Baghdad is key for fueling the Dredge engine.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells such as Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Psychic Frog. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to further control the opponent's board state. Additionally, the deck features card draw and selection spells like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time to ensure consistency and find key pieces. With the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan and draw into important cards, this Esper control deck is designed to dominate the game and secure victory.

This deck utilizes a control strategy focused on disruption and efficiency, using cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the game while also drawing cards and searching for answers with Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Demonic Tutor. Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog provide additional disruption and tempo advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a unique element to the deck, allowing for additional recursion and value. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Null Rod. By utilizing mana acceleration from Moxen and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland can also disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void can further slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win through aggressive attacking and resource denial, creating a challenging environment for the opponent to navigate.

The deck utilizes a combination of powerful control cards and the Oath of Druids enchantment to quickly put powerful creatures into play, including Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal while ramping into big threats with cards like Show and Tell and Tinker. The inclusion of Bolas's Citadel and various powerful mana artifacts allows for explosive plays and quick wins. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play quickly. It also includes a strong control package with counterspells like Force of Will and disruption cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through powerful spells like Show and Tell and Tinker. It also includes additional card draw and tutoring to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a way to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Oko, Thief of Crowns. It also includes various powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for ramp, along with disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and interaction like Thoughtseize. The deck is designed to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through Oath of Druids and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through artifacts and spells, while also using card draw and manipulation to find key combo pieces. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan until it can assemble its win condition, utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Time Vault to create a loop of extra turns or generate a massive advantage. The presence of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another dimension to the deck's strategy, offering additional resilience and flexibility.

This deck focuses on taking advantage of artifacts and card draw to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards quickly, ultimately leading to a powerful win condition. The main goal is to use cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Lrien Revealed to bounce back artifacts for additional value and draw more cards, while also utilizing cards like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den to create infinite loops and win the game. By efficiently using mana rocks and card draw spells, the deck aims to set up a quick and powerful combo finish.

The deck revolves around utilizing the powerful interaction between Underworld Breach and various spells to quickly assemble and execute a devastating combo. By maximizing card draw, tutor effects, and protection spells, the goal is to efficiently recur key pieces from the graveyard to generate infinite storm count or mana, leading to a game-winning Brain Freeze or Tendrils of Agony finish. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Hullbreacher and untap effects like Time Walk further enhance the deck's consistency and ability to disrupt opposing strategies.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Underworld Breach with other powerful cards like Brain Freeze, Wheel of Fortune, and Timetwister to create a loop that allows for infinite casting of spells from the graveyard. The deck includes various powerful mana accelerants and card selection engines, along with disruptive cards like Hullbreacher and Force of Will to protect the combo. The overall strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan, leading to a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces needed to utilize Underworld Breach to cast multiple spells from the graveyard and potentially win the game in one explosive turn. The deck includes powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly power out spells, along with various card draw and tutoring effects to find the combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Hullbreacher to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to combo off quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - BUG Midrange deck focuses on disruption and control while maintaining a fast, aggressive strategy. The deck includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor to draw key cards and answer threats. Additionally, it features disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt opponents' strategies. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce provide further protection and interaction. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting opponents' game plans to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' mana bases with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Sundering Eruption while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Pyrogoyf. The deck also utilizes fast mana acceleration through cards like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly deploy threats and lock out opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming opponents with a combination of disruptive elements and aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Narcomoeba. By constantly milling cards and putting creatures into play from the graveyard, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return are key in enabling explosive combos and generating advantage from the graveyard. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Chalice of the Void help to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure with aggressive threats like Hollow One and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards through dredge mechanics and utilize them to bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. This allows for explosive combos with cards like Hollow One and Grief, utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll to continuously dredge through the deck. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to control the game while setting up for the combo win condition. The strategy revolves around using the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on using control elements like countermagic and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. It also utilizes the companion mechanic with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as an additional resource. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and card advantage engines like Psychic Frog. Overall, the key concept revolves around controlling the game's pace and resources to eventually emerge victorious in the 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing control and denial tactics to disrupt the opponent's strategy while efficiently drawing cards and maintaining a strong defense. It utilizes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of powerful card draw spells and tutoring effects allow the player to find key cards quickly. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion that provides additional value and resilience to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and provide versatility.

The deck is focused on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It also utilizes powerful draw spells and card selection to maintain card advantage and find key pieces of the deck. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring key cards from the graveyard, adding an additional layer of resilience to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also including utility lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine for additional disruption.

This deck relies on managing the opponent's resources through countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting their game plan. By controlling the game tempo and leveraging card advantage, it aims to outlast the opponent and eventually establish a dominant position on the board. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur key permanents and maintain a resilient board presence. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and efficient removal spells, this deck seeks to grind out wins through careful and calculated play.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and flexibility. The deck includes powerful cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to handle threats, along with versatile spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards. Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog provide additional disruption against opponent's strategies. This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent through countermagic and removal spells, while also gaining card advantage through cantrips and draw spells. By controlling the board and resource management, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while controlling the board. The deck focuses on assembling the Time Vault combo using cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to take extra turns and win the game quickly. It also includes powerful disruption like Force of Will and Leyline of the Void to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Moxen and Mana Crypt to ramp into its combo pieces quickly. The inclusion of card draw spells like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe help dig for combo pieces while also disrupting the opponent's hand.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hate cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Chancellor of the Annex, and Archon of Emeria, while pressuring them with aggressive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration through cards like Chrome Mox and Mox Pearl, paired with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down opponents. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to secure a victory.

With a mix of disruptive creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using hatebears to disrupt opponents' game plans while also deploying aggressive creatures to apply pressure. The mana base is optimized for consistency and enables the deck to cast its spells efficiently and consistently disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck aims to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck focuses on utilizing key artifacts and spells to generate significant card advantage and mana acceleration, ultimately leading to a powerful combo finish with Paradoxical Outcome. It aims to control the game with card draw and disruption while setting up a win condition through a powerful turn involving Time Vault and Voltaic Key or other key artifact interactions. The deck is highly efficient and requires careful sequencing and resource management to execute its game plan effectively, making it a challenging and rewarding archetype to pilot in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on a fast and efficient combo utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and storm count. It includes powerful mana rocks and spells like Time Vault and Urza's Saga to support the combo. The deck also features disruptive counterspells and removal to protect the combo and control the game. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion, providing additional value by allowing the player to recast key spells from the graveyard. The strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck relies on using artifacts, specifically Coveted Jewel and The One Ring, to generate a large amount of mana with cards like Grim Monolith and Mana Crypt. It also includes key combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to take multiple turns in a row. Paradoxical Outcome allows you to draw a lot of cards and replay your artifacts. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo. Overall, the goal is to assemble your combo pieces quickly and overwhelm your opponent with powerful artifact synergy.

The deck aims to efficiently generate mana and card advantage through artifacts and powerful spells to create a dominant board state and outpace the opponent in Vintage 1 vs 1 gameplay. By leveraging cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Mishra's Workshop along with powerful artifacts like Grim Monolith and The One Ring, the deck is able to quickly assemble key combos such as the Time Vault + Voltaic Key combo or big mana plays with Coveted Jewel and Phyrexian Metamorph. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and fast mana sources to generate a large amount of mana quickly, digging through the deck with cards like Paradoxical Outcome to find combo pieces such as Time Vault and The One Ring to win the game. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Trinisphere to prevent the opponent from interfering with the combo. The key strategy is to set up a situation where the player can take infinite turns or generate a significant advantage through card advantage and mana ramping.

This deck focuses on quickly filling your graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Grief. It then uses reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring these creatures back into play for a devastating combo finish. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy to protect your combo pieces. Overall, the goal is to efficiently reanimate threatening creatures early in the game to overwhelm your opponent before they can respond effectively.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel, before using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to set up a game-winning combo involving cards like Time Vault and Trinisphere. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the game and protect the combo. The deck utilizes key artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate its game plan, while also having access to powerful blue spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk for card advantage and tempo.

The deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to continuously recur spells from the graveyard, allowing for explosive combos and powerful plays. It includes multiple mana acceleration sources like lotus and moxen, along with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Ponder to find key pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counter spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, as well as removal with Fatal Push. The goal is to efficiently assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful win condition.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Underworld Breach and other powerful cards in order to combo off and win the game quickly. By combining cards like Hullbreacher, Bolas's Citadel, Lotus Petal, and Brain Freeze, the deck aims to generate a lot of mana and draw through the deck to find the necessary pieces to create a winning loop. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and Pyroblast, as well as tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, the deck can adapt to different situations and outmaneuver opponents.
